definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Later, in Walpole he was a peerless handball player.
sentences.chinese: 后来在沃波尔，他成了无人可与之匹敌的手球运动员。

sentences.english: A sport similar to the handball, called croquet, originally existed in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 地处中欧的德国原有类似手球的活动，称为门球。

sentences.english: On the base that plays sanded bag in adroitness control, let a student change bump handball.
sentences.chinese: 在熟练掌握踢沙包的基础上，让学生改换颠手球。

sentences.english: Replays left no doubt that it was the hand of Maradona that scored the goal.
sentences.chinese: 比赛录像清晰无疑地显示了马拉多纳是手球得分的。

sentences.english: I have one -- two forehands winners down the line.
sentences.chinese: 有一两个正手球正打在线上。

sentences.english: Also rugby and handball have their adherents.
sentences.chinese: 橄榄球和手球同样也有他们的拥护者。

sentences.english: You could even incorporate it into jumping rope or a sport like racquetball.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以用跳绳和手球式壁球来组合。

sentences.english: Refereeing is one the most discussed parts of handball.
sentences.chinese: 执裁是手球中备受讨论的部分之一。

sentences.english: Jack used to see Marvin playing handball at the Y.
sentences.chinese: 杰克过去总是在基督教青年会观看马文打手球。

sentences.english: It's an indirect free-kick from where he dived on the ball.
sentences.chinese: 在他手球的地点判给对方一个间接任意球。

sentences.english: Her father is too corpulent to play handball.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲太胖以至不能玩手球。

definition: croquet/goal ball (served by the goal keeper)
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
(sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
